comment.body:
Hi, thanks for replying on ZeroTalk. I have a question.

Just to be clear, do I change  the entire line of:
```python
"inner_path": "data/users/content.json",
```
 and change it to 
```python
siteSign sitehash --inner_path data/users/content.json --publish
```
?

I'm very new to python.

> [erkan](#comment_95_1H8oKiRa7fGgUqS1hpUtaSYLvAqkaknbkf): @theta no, don't change the file itself. 
> It's a command to execute. I have now updated the above description.See the line starting with "python zeronet.py etc."

I still can't get it to work :/
I get the following log:


```python
- Starting ZeroNet...
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "zeronet.py", line 15, in main
    import main
  File "src/main.py", line 8, in <module>
    import gevent
ImportError: No module named gevent
```

Any idea what I'm doing wrong?

> [erkan](#comment_104_1H8oKiRa7fGgUqS1hpUtaSYLvAqkaknbkf): @theta you are missing a dependency: python-gevent
> Please see on the https://github.com/HelloZeroNet/ZeroNet page for more dependencies you might also miss and need to install.(I also assume you are not running ZeroBundle, since it should have all dependencies inside.)

Okay, so I downloaded and "installed" GitHub's ZeroNet bundle, but I still get the same error..  
So, if I guess did not get  "python-gevent" in the standard bundle. 
Thank you for your patience
This question is completely off topic but, how did you manage to change your "profile picture" on your blog?  :)

Hi again!
I have been trying to change my avatar by following your instructions. However, I can't seem to get it working.
I have followed every step, the only step I'm insecure about is the last one. So when I have done the first 3 steps. Were do you sign and publish? 
I have tried to do that in two different ways but none of them will publish my new avatar.

This is my blog: http://127.0.0.1:43110/1KVkSrfNoCRjjQEFDK3xKXeL71Byi2yLpF/?Home

Yep, use both suggestions.. Even tried to change the avatar image format from PNG to JPG.. 

> [erkan](#comment_127_1H8oKiRa7fGgUqS1hpUtaSYLvAqkaknbkf): @theta you can sign and publish in 2 ways:a. in terminal, see FAQ orb. via the UI (see pic of hidden menu here, search for: "via the hidden menu")

I have the following code in index.html-file: "
" and yes, my image in the img-folder is named avatar.png. Thank you for your patience > [erkan](#comment_128_1H8oKiRa7fGgUqS1hpUtaSYLvAqkaknbkf): @theta I am not sure what you have done, but: > I checked with 2 proxies and your index.html file does NOT contain anything relating to avatar, as I wrote in section III. in the blog post here.Did you delete something?Where did you edit the changes I speak of in section III. ?

hmm. When I trying to publish the blog the manual way, I get the following:
"$ zeronet.py sitePublish 1KVkSrfNoCRjjQEFDK3xKXeL71Byi2yLpF
-bash: zeronet.py: command not found"

> [erkan](#comment_129_1H8oKiRa7fGgUqS1hpUtaSYLvAqkaknbkf): @theta you don't understand,the index.html file I downloaded from the proxies (e.g. you can verify with wget also) has NOT such a change.
> Most likely, you have a fault-pas during sign/publish, please check the manual again how to sign.Also, do it the manual way, so you can see if there is an error given
